relation: configure terminal Example: Controller# configure terminal
ap dot11 5ghz shutdown Example: Controller(config)# ap dot11 5ghz shutdown
{ap | no ap} dot11 5ghz channelswitch mode switch_mode Example: Controller(config)# ap dot11 5ghz channelswitch mode 0
ap dot11 5ghz power-constraint value Example: Controller(config)# ap dot11 5ghz power-constraint 200
no ap dot11 5ghz shutdown Example: Controller(config)# no ap dot11 5ghz shutdown

Enables or disables the access point to announce when it is switching to a new channel. You can enter a 0 or 1 for the channelswitch parameter to specify whether transmissions are restricted until the actual channel switch (0) or are not restricted (1). The default value is disabled.
Configures the 802.11h power constraint value in a range from zero through 255. The default value for the value parameter is 3 dB.
Returns to privileged EXEC mode. Alternatively, you can also press Ctrl-Z to exit global configuration mode.
pageTitle: Consolidated Platform Configuration Guide, Cisco IOS XE Release 3.3SE (Cisco WLC 5700 Series) - Configuring 802.11 parameters and Band Selection [Cisco 5700 Series Wireless LAN Controllers] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {9889=You can enter a value for threshold between 1 and 1000 for the milliseconds parameter., 93567=The beacon period in controllers is listed in terms of milliseconds. The beacon period can also be measured in time units, where one time unit equals 1024 microseconds or 102.4 milliseconds. If a beacon interval is listed as 100 milliseconds in a controller, it is only a rounded off value for 102.4 milliseconds. Due to hardware limitation in certain radios, even though the beacon interval is, say 100 time units, it is adjusted to 102 time units, which roughly equals 104.448 milliseconds. When the beacon period is to be represented in terms of time units, the value is adjusted to the nearest multiple of 17.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {2081=The beacon interval is measured in time units (TUs). One TU is 1024 microseconds. You can configure the access point to send a beacon every 20 to 1000 milliseconds., 2982=The threshold is a value between 256 and 2346 bytes (inclusive). Specify a low number for areas where communication is poor or where there is a great deal of radio interference.}
textBeforeTable: DETAILED STEPS 9.    end 8.    wlan wlan_profile_name wlan_ID SSID_network_name band-select 7.    end 6.    wireless client band-select client-rssi client_rssi 5.    wireless client band-select expire dual-band seconds 4.    wireless client band-select expire suppression seconds 3.    wireless client band-select cycle-threshold milliseconds 2.    wireless client band-select cycle-count cycle_count 1.    configure terminal SUMMARY STEPS Configuring Band Selection (CLI) How to Configure 802.11 Bands and Parameters 802.11h informs client devices about channel changes and can limit the transmit power of those client devices. 802.11h Parameter The 802.11n high-throughput rates are available on all 802.11n access points for WLANs using WMM with no Layer 2 encryption or with WPA2/AES encryption enabled. This section provides instructions for managing 802.11n devices such as the Cisco Aironet 1140 and 3600 Series Access Points on your network. The 802.11n devices support the 2.4- and 5-GHz bands and offer high-throughput data rates. 802.11n Parameter When a controller is configured
textAfterTable: Step 7 end Example: Controller(config)# end   Returns to privileged EXEC mode. Alternatively, you can also press Ctrl-Z to exit global configuration mode.   Step 8 wlan wlan_profile_name wlan_ID SSID_network_name band-select Example: Controller(config)# wlan wlan1 25 ssid12 Controller(config-wlan)# band-select   Configures band selection on specific WLANs. You can enter a value between 1 and 512 for the wlan_ID parameter. You can enter the up to 32 alphanumeric characters for SSID_network_name parameter.   Step 9 end Example: Controller(config)# end   Returns to privileged EXEC mode. Alternatively, you can also press Ctrl-Z to exit global configuration mode.   Configuring the 802.11 Bands (CLI) You can configure 802.11 bands and parameters.
